text:
Greg Foot: Hey guys, so this is the eleventh
explanation video for the '12 Explosions of
Christmas'.
I'm Greg!
Mike: and I'm Mike.
Greg: And this is eleven baubles a'blazing.
Oh yes!

Mike: So what we've got here, we've got thermite
in flower pots.
Greg: Ha!
This is going to be brilliant.

So in each of our home made baubles we've
got a thermite mix inside and it's going to
be lit by the sparklers.
What was the mix?

Mike: Right, so thermite is just a mixture
of aluminium powder and iron oxide -- rust,
simple rust, that's all it is!
It's amazing!

It's got enough oxygen and the aluminium burns
so hot that it rips the oxygen away from iron
oxide.
Greg: and that leaves molten iron.

So that's what you're going to see when it
all ignites, it's going to be lit by the sparklers,

it's going to go down, it's going to get white
hot, absolutely crazy.

It's gonna produce molten iron which is gonna
drop out of the bottom of the flower pots.
Mike: It's going to be great.
Greg: It's going to look stunning.

This is how you do it, and of course we have
to say, don't try this at home!
Let's go!

Oh and this is last year's trees that we've
sprayed the bottom of because we're not wasteful
like that.
Mike: I think that worked rather well!
Greg: Yeah!

I think you can see the molten iron in that
top bauble, have a look, have a look!
